column4: hey online somoeme posted how to reinstall the system or something liek that
but it needs su
and su tells me "sorry, authentication failed"
what's up with that?
does anyone know how to use su?
ubuntu uses sudo
reinstall the system or something like that?
i was told for what i'm doing it's too hardcare for sudo and i need su
wait a second
before using some random command- how exactly doesn't gnome work and what command are you using to fix it?
one of the ideas of having a root user or using sudo is to make you think before using a command. so what are you trying to do?
my bro said he rebooted his comp, and now all he gets when booting into gnome is a mouse cursor on a brown background
i just want gnome working, and i don't know what i'm trying to do
then follow the directions that guy gave you to create a root account
i don't see why you can't do it with sudo
i got root working
but now it's pulling the whole bullshit error,  run apt-get update to fix it
you shoudl apt-get update
i did apt-get update, like it said
that did alot of things
however, fixing the problem was not one of them. it still did it again
what exactly is the error?
oh, no error
just nothign mroe than a mouse cursor, unless i do failsafe terminal, in which case i get a terminal in teh corna
